page.title: 05INSECTS CUCKFIELD RURAL
page.content: This area is mostly farmland and has the usual selection of insects found on pasture and grassland, such as grasshoppers, beetles, flies, lady- birds, ants, woodlice, spiders and many others as well as dragonflies and mayflies down by the river. Although several types of butterfly and moth have become more scarce with the dis- appearence of deciduous woodland and replanting with conifers, there are still many of the common ones to be seen including Peacocks (inachis is), Brimstones (gonepteryx rhamni), Red Admirals (vanessa atalanta), Cabbage White (pieridae) and the Elephant Hawk Moth (deilephila elpenor). There have also been sightings of the rare Silver washed Fritillery (argynnis paphia), White Admiral (limenitis camilla) and Purple Emperor (apatura iris). All no- ted by Mr.Stephen Knight,a resident.
